extendedIngredients.name: cabbage
extendedIngredients.original: 1 to 2 leaves nappa cabbage, sliced crosswise into ½-inch thick strips, or any greens.
extendedIngredients.originalName: nappa cabbage, sliced crosswise into ½-inch thick strips, or any greens

extendedIngredients.name: green onions
extendedIngredients.original: 2 green onions, sliced thinly to garnish
extendedIngredients.originalName: green onions, sliced thinly to garnish

extendedIngredients.name: miso
extendedIngredients.original: Do not reheat the miso soup after the miso has been added; the flavor diminishes with reheating. Miso paste is generally available in the Asian sections of well-stocked supermarkets, as well as at Asi

title: Miso Soup With Crispy Age Tofu, Nappa Cabbage And Green Onions
summary: Miso Soup With Crispy Age Tofu, Nappa Cabbage And Green Onions might be just the main course you are searching for. This recipe serves 1 and costs $6.93 per serving. Watching your figure? This gluten free and vegan recipe has 602 calories, 61g of protein, and 25g of fat per serving. Head to the store and pick up nappa cabbage, age tofu, miso paste, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the tofu you could follow this main course with the Tofu Cheesecake as a dessert. This recipe is typical of Japanese cuisine. This recipe from latimes.com has 18 fans. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 45 minutes. It will be a hit at your Autumn event. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 92%. This score is awesome. Similar recipes include Peking Duck Broth With Nappa Cabbage, Miso-Glazed Tofu with Cabbage & Peppers, and Warm Cabbage Salad with Crispy Tofu.

winePairing.pairingText: Asian works really well with Gewurztraminer, Chenin Blanc, and Riesling. The best wine for Asian food depends on the cuisine and dish - of course - but these acidic whites pair with a number of traditional meals, spicy or not. One wine you could try is Hugel Gewurztraminer Jubilee. It has 4.3 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 44 dollars.

productMatches.title: Hugel Gewurztraminer Jubilee
productMatches.description: Hugel's "Jubilee" are sourced exclusively from family owned Grand Cru vineyards in the top terroirs in Alsace. Great classic Gewurztraminer which will gain in complexity and spiciness for 8 years or more. Its suave and long complex aftertaste will make it the ideal partner to strong cheeses and spicy dishes.
